page.title: 02Introduction 2 Contd.
page.content: The town of Wareham is rectangular and covers 37 hectares approx. The area designated by the block takes in the West side of Wareham, known as Lady St. Mary, Wareham. The twelve square kilometre block which will hence forth be called Wareham Lady St. Mary and will include Binnegar Plain, Worgret Heath, Trigon Estate, Northport, Cold Harbour and Carey Heath. The area has a long history going back to the Anglo Saxon period. Archeaological excavations support the theory that the site of Wareham has been occupied since pre Roman conquest times and it is believed that Wareham was the {capital {town}of the Durotriges. Ancient barrows and banks can be found across this area.
